word: I entreat you who have long professed the faith and who still pay outward homage to Christ: Do not deceive your own souls. It is the whole heart that Jesus prizes. The loyalty of the soul is alone of value in the sight of God. \93If thou hadst known, even thou, at least in this thy day, the things which belong unto thy peace!\94 \93Thou . . . even thou\94\97Christ is at this moment addressing you personally, stooping from His throne, yearning with pitying tenderness over those who feel not their danger, who have no pity for themselves.\97Testimonies for the Church, vol. 5, pp. 72, 73.
